canDo: I can make and change appointments by phone or in person.

rules.title: Can/Could I + verb for requests
rules.explanation: Use 'Can I' or 'Could I' (more polite) to make requests. 'Could' is more formal.
examples: Could I speak to the doctor?
rules.koreanTip: 'Could I'가 'Can I'보다 더 공손해요. 병원이나 공식적인 상황에서는 'Could I'를 쓰세요.

rules.title: Time prepositions: at, on, in
rules.explanation: Use 'at' for specific times, 'on' for days/dates, 'in' for parts of day/months/years.

rules.title: Would + time + be okay/work?
rules.explanation: Use 'Would [time] be okay?' or 'Would [time] work for you?' to suggest appointment times.
rules.koreanTip: 시간을 제안할 때 'Would ~ work for you?'를 쓰면 공손해요.

exercises.question: ___ I make an appointment for next Monday?
exercises.explanation: 'Could I' is polite when making a request.

exercises.question: Your appointment is ___ Wednesday ___ 2 PM.
exercises.explanation: Use 'on' for days and 'at' for specific times.

exercises.question: Would Friday afternoon ___ for you?
exercises.koreanTip: 'Would ~ be okay?'는 시간을 제안하는 공손한 표현이에요.

exercises.question: Which is correct?
exercises.explanation: Use 'on' before days of the week.

words.meaning: free to meet or be used
to change to a different time
examples: I need to reschedule my appointment.
Can we reschedule for next week?

words.meaning: to stop something that was planned
examples: I'd like to cancel my appointment.

words.meaning: to make sure something is correct
examples: I'm calling to confirm my appointment.
words.koreanTip: 예약을 확인할 때 'I'd like to confirm my appointment'라고 해요

words.meaning: a time period for an appointment
examples: We have a slot available at 4 PM.

reading.title: Changing a Doctor's Appointment
reading.passage: Hello, this is Dr. Kim's office. How can I help you? Hi, my name is Park Minjun. I have an appointment scheduled for this Thursday at 10 AM, but I need to reschedule it. Something came up at work. I understand. Let me check the schedule. Would Friday morning work for you? I'm afraid I'm not available on Friday morning. Do you have any slots in the afternoon? We have an opening at 2:30 PM on Friday. Would that be okay? That would be perfect. Thank you. Great! Your new appointment is confirmed for Friday at 2:30 PM. We'll send you a reminder text message. Thank you so much. Goodbye!

questions.question: Why does the caller need to reschedule?
questions.explanation: The caller says 'Something came up at work.'

questions.question: What is the new appointment time?
questions.explanation: The passage confirms 'Your new appointment is confirmed for Friday at 2:30 PM.'

questions.question: What does 'opening' mean in this context?
questions.explanation: 'Opening' here means an available appointment slot.

listening.title: Making a Dental Appointment
listening.script: Good morning, Seoul Dental Clinic. How may I help you? Hi, I'd like to make an appointment for a check-up. Certainly. Is this your first visit? Yes, it is. Okay, when would you like to come in? As soon as possible, please. We have a slot available tomorrow at 11 AM. Would that work for you? Yes, that's perfect. May I have your name? It's Lee Jisoo. L-E-E J-I-S-O-O. Great, Ms. Lee. You're all set for tomorrow, Wednesday, at 11 AM. Please arrive 10 minutes early to fill out some paperwork. No problem. Thank you!

exercises.question: What kind of appointment is the caller making?
exercises.explanation: The caller says 'I'd like to make an appointment for a check-up' at a dental clinic.

exercises.question: The caller should arrive ___ minutes early.
exercises.explanation: The receptionist says 'Please arrive 10 minutes early.'

template.prompt: Write a phone conversation to make an appointment.
template.template:
Receptionist: Hello, [PLACE]. How can I help you?
Caller: Hi, I'd like to [ACTION].
Receptionist: Certainly. When would you like to come in?
Caller: Could I come on [DAY] at [TIME]?
Receptionist: Let me check. Yes, we have a slot available. Your appointment is confirmed for [DAY] at [TIME].
Caller: Great, thank you!

slots.name: DAY
slots.hint: Day of the week or date

template.correctExample:
Receptionist: Hello, Seoul Medical Center. How can I help you?
Caller: Hi, I'd like to make an appointment with Dr. Park.
Receptionist: Certainly. When would you like to come in?
Caller: Could I come on Tuesday at 3 PM?
Receptionist: Let me check. Yes, we have a slot available. Your appointment is confirmed for Tuesday at 3 PM.
Caller: Great, thank you!

checklist.item: Explain why you need to reschedule

shadowing.sentence: I'd like to make an appointment for next Tuesday. Would 2 PM work? If not, when would be the earliest available slot?
shadowing.pronunciation: /aɪd laɪk tuː meɪk ən əˈpɔɪntmənt fɔːr nekst ˈtuːzdeɪ wʊd tuː piː em wɜːrk ɪf nɑːt wen wʊd biː ði ˈɜːrliɪst əˈveɪləbl slɑːt/
shadowing.koreanTip: 'Would 2 PM work?'에서 would는 약하게 발음해요. '우드'가 아니라 '웓'처럼 빠르게요.

checklistItems: Use 'I'd like to' for polite requests

koreanErrors.correctForm: I have an appointment on Monday.
koreanErrors.tip: 'appointment'는 셀 수 있는 명사라서 'an'이 필요하고, 요일 앞에는 'on'을 써요.

koreanErrors.correctForm: I'd like to cancel my reservation.
koreanErrors.explanation: Use 'I'd like to' for polite requests and add 'my' before 'reservation'.
koreanErrors.tip: 'I want'보다 'I'd like'가 더 공손해요. 또한 'my reservation'처럼 소유격을 써주세요.

koreanErrors.explanation: The stress is on the second syllable: a-POINT-ment.
